qas.question: The mahayana occasionally referred to early Buddhism as what?
What term was more politically correct term for the word Hinayana?

context: Scholar Isabelle Onians asserts that although "the Mahāyāna ... very occasionally referred contemptuously to earlier Buddhism as the Hinayāna, the Inferior Way," "the preponderance of this name in the secondary literature is far out of proportion to occurrences in the Indian texts." She notes that the term <a1_0>Śrāvakayāna<a1_0/> was "the more politically correct and much more usual" term used by Mahāyānists. Jonathan Silk has argued that the term "<a0_0>Hinayana<a0_0/>" was used to refer to whomever one wanted to criticize on any given occasion, and did not refer to any definite grouping of Buddhists.
